data.title: Metal ‚Äî Ian's Untitled Scene Show
data.text:
Viewing entries tagged

Nu-Metal

Welcome to a brand new episode of Ian‚Äôs Untitled Scene Show! In this episode, it‚Äôs a fan favorite: the 2023 year-end SCENE wrap-up show featuring Jake Whalen of Pyro, Ohio!

It‚Äôs been a long time since I got to record a full show on the Scene, so I was thrilled when Jake was excited as well. We discuss the Scene in general, talk about many albums out in 2023, the best EPs (in Ian‚Äôs opinion), and much more! There‚Äôs so much to review, so this is just PART 1. In Part 2, we review the best and worst of the Scene in 2023 (and more, of course)! So don‚Äôt be surprised when you get to the end of Part 1, and it‚Äôs a Spider-Man: Across The Spider-Verse cliffhanger ü§ò

Correction: Skylar is the bassist of Issues, not the guitarist, and Michael‚Äôs last name is ‚ÄòBohn‚Äô ü§ò

Check out the exclusive conversation below (and Part 2 soon), including iTunes, Spotify, Stitcher, and more:

Spotify ü§ò iTunes ü§ò Google Play Music

Make sure to support Pyro, Ohio, in all they do! And don‚Äôt forget to listen to ‚ÄòOf Shadows and Substance‚Äô repeatedly! Check out all the ways to support them below:

Instagram ü§ò Facebook ü§ò Twitter ü§ò Bandcamp ü§ò Merch ü§ò Tiktok ü§ò Jake‚Äôs Podcast

Also, building another brand is challenging. Please pardon any name and content change issues as everything gets worked out. If you liked what you heard and want to hear more and see more, please support by following and sharing on these sites:

Facebook ü§ò Instagram ü§ò Twitter

Want to listen somewhere other than the website?

Subscribe on these sites:

Spotify ü§ò iTunes ü§ò Google Play Music

Also, check out the new off-the-cuff 30-minute podcast Ian does on many topics called Kiss The Ring. You can‚Äôt listen on any of those sites, just on the website (still free as always):

Kiss The Ring Podcast

Welcome to a brand new episode of Ian‚Äôs Untitled Scene Show! This episode is a party because I welcome guitarist and vocalist Nick ‚ÄòNeeco‚Äô Trahan, drummer Robb Barrio, bassist Travvy Thomas, and guitarist Mattie Cortopassi of New Orlean‚Äôs HourHouse!

HourHouse is a newer genre-bending band to me, but I‚Äôm thrilled I got to hear their new album, ‚ÄòGold Tooth Guru,‚Äô that just came out recently through UNFD (that means you should check it out, too)! We talk about the new album, New Orleans, and have one of the most fun and confusing debates I‚Äôve ever had on the show! Hahaha.

It‚Äôs a lot of fun getting to know HourHouse, and you won‚Äôt want to miss it ü§ò

Note: this recording was performed using a brand-new audio setup, so there were some audio issues (primarily because of the conferencing software). I did my best to smooth everything out. I hope you still enjoy it ü§ò

Check out the exclusive interview below, including iTunes, Spotify, and more:

Spotify ü§ò iTunes ü§ò Google Play Music

Big thanks to the guys for taking the time to be on the show! Make sure to support HourHouse in all they do, and pick up the new album, ‚ÄòGold Tooth Guru,‚Äô RIGHT NOW! Also, they have a show in Dallas on December 22nd! Check out the links below to make it easy:

Music Video ü§ò Instagram ü§ò Facebook ü§ò X ü§ò Spotify ü§ò Merch ü§ò Band Links ü§ò Dallas Show

If you liked what you heard and want to hear more and see more, please support by following and sharing on these sites:

Kiss The Ring Podcast

Welcome to a brand new episode of Ian‚Äôs Untitled Scene Show! In this episode, I feature someone I‚Äôve wanted to speak with for a long time, Chris ‚ÄúCream‚Äù Ratzlaff, vocalist for Fallstar!

Chris is always a busy man, as he has a family with three children, not to mention fronting the unique and genre-bending metalcore band Fallstar AND being a part of two other bands, Northlander and Cobra Cobra! We focus our talk mostly on Fallstar (but make sure to check out his other projects, too), their crowdfunding ideas, the new album ‚ÄòSacred Mirrors,‚Äô and so much more!

I don‚Äôt want to give away everything here; trust that you will enjoy this conversation‚Ä¶(Donnie Darko is all I‚Äôll say right now‚Ä¶)

Check out the exclusive conversation below, including iTunes, Spotify, Stitcher, and more:

Spotify ü§ò iTunes ü§ò Google Play Music

Make sure to support Chris and Fallstar in all they do! And don‚Äôt forget to catch them on the upcoming live dates and listen to ‚ÄòSacred Mirrors‚Äô over and over! Check out all the ways to support them below:

Linktree ü§ò Tour ü§ò Instagram ü§ò Facebook ü§ò Twitter ü§ò Music ü§ò Merch

Welcome to a brand new episode of Ian‚Äôs Untitled Scene Show! In this episode, I feature another first for IUSS, and new friend of the show, Kyle Pastor of Archetypes Collide!

It‚Äôs a huge week for Kyle and Archetypes Collide as their debut self-titled album comes out THIS FRIDAY (March 31st) through Fearless Records! Kyle talks about what the release means, his passion for songwriting, and much more! I have a feeling you‚Äôll be able to hear Kyle‚Äôs smile throughout the whole interview ü§ò

Check out the exclusive interview below, including iTunes, Spotify, Stitcher, and more:

Welcome to a brand new episode of Ian‚Äôs Untitled Scene Show! In this episode, I feature a favorite of mine, and new friend of the show, Chad Ruhlig, lead vocalist for For The Fallen Dreams!

For The Fallen Dreams (FTFD) are at an exciting and fun stage of their career. Spanning over 20 years (technically), they have just released their self-titled album through Arising Empire! That‚Äôs their 7th album, the first with a new label and a huge sonic change! While on tour with Gideon, Chad discusses all this and much more. You‚Äôre going to enjoy this.

Check out the exclusive interview below, including iTunes, Spotify, Stitcher, and more:

Spotify ü§ò iTunes ü§ò Stitcher ü§ò Google Play Music

Make sure to support Chad and For The Fallen Dreams in all they do! And don‚Äôt forget, the new album ‚ÄòFor The Fallen Dreams‚Äô is NOW AVAILABLE through Arising Empire! Check out all the ways to support them below:

I was visited by the ghosts of Scene past, present, and future, and even though they agreed with all my opinions of the scene, the one thing they wanted from me was to stop trying to make everything perfect and just put out episodes without worrying about making them sound studio quality. So, here‚Äôs the end of 2020 episode with all the scars that the real 2020 has (i.e. no editing, you get what you get). No one seems to care when shows sound like it‚Äôs two guys in a bathroom stall and not humorous whatsoever, so why would you care that Dave is halfway across the country and there‚Äôs some background noise?

Anyway, I‚Äôm hanging out with the Scene ghosts right now listening to From First to Last and talking about how terrible Alt Press is. Enjoy the jokes and please stay safe and healthy this holiday season!

Happy Holidays!

Merry Christmas!

Happy New Year!

Stay Scene!

It‚Äôs the end of the decade! Yes, it didn‚Äôt happen at the beginning of 2020, it happens at the end! To celebrate this oh so special of occasions, Dave put together his list of the worst scene albums of the decade! This is a really fun conversation, so go have some fun yourself and take a listen! Really, I think that‚Äôs all the hype you need.

Big shout out to Rick, who helps anytime I need a promo image! Thanks so much, man! Go follow him on Twitter!

For some reason, Ian and James have trouble speaking in this episode of Ian Hates Music, but it turns out they have a lot to speak about, like, what the fuck is going on in the scene?!?!?

It‚Äôs like it‚Äôs war all of the time now.

Get ready for your best weekly dose of metalcore, post-hardcore, metal, hardcore, electronicore, emo, screamo, rock, alternative, pop-punk, punk, easycore, deathcore, nu-metal, and really, all the core you could ever want!

It's another FUCKING GREAT, FUCKING FREE (NSFW) episode of Ian Hates Music you say?!?! That's right! Ian and James talk your scene news from:

Disrupt Festival, Static-X, and As I Lay Dying‚Ä¶

And New Songs talk from:

Bad Religion, Death Therapy, Above A Whisper, Saving Vice, Wind Walkers, Frank Carter & The Rattlesnakes, Awake At Last, The Molten Larva, Rammstein, In Her Own Words, and LIMBS!

Add on album reviews from:

A Wake in Providence - The Blvck Sun II The Blood Moon - Outerloop Records

I Prevail - Trauma - Fearless Records

Whitechapel - The Valley - Metal Blade Records

Lotus Eater - Social Hazard - Hopeless Records

Low Dose - Low Dose - Brutal Panda Records

High Rise - Endeavours - EP - Independent Release

A Blessing A Curse - Waste - Smartpunk Records

Bloodline - Better View - Stay Sick Recordings

Plus, stuff and/or things and maybe some more!

Also, Ian has opened a Patreon to help with the costs of the many Ian Hates shows. If you have the means, please donate to keep the shows and quality going! Link below:

It‚Äôs time for a brand new episode of Ian Hates Music! James is back, Ian is still not 100% after being sick for a week and a half, but as Fronz says ‚ÄúIt Is What It Is‚Äù, so you may hear his voice give out every once in while (lucky you!)‚Ä¶The guys have all the fun scene news and some not so fun as well, so, you know what to do!

Get ready for your best weekly dose of metalcore, post-hardcore, metal, hardcore, electronicore, emo, screamo, rock, alternative, pop-punk, punk, easycore, deathcore, nu-metal, and really, all the core you could ever want!

It's another FUCKING GREAT, FUCKING FREE (NSFW) episode of Ian Hates Music you say?!?! That's right! Ian and James talk your scene news from:

The Ghost Inside, Ozzy, Breaking Benjamin, Marilyn Manson, A Day To Remember, Warped Tour, Doyle Wolfgang Von Frankenstein, The Word Alive, Blessthefall, Wage War, and a serious conversation (on a comedy show) about sexual misconduct/assault accusations in the scene. This is not a conversation about who is ‚Äúright‚Äù and who is ‚Äúwrong‚Äù. This conversation does not choose sides and does not expect you to either. It is an analytical conversation, all speculation, all opinion, on the current state of accusations that happen to take place in the scene. If you like an open conversation with no judgements that may actually be thought provoking, then this conversation is for you. If not, you can skip it and go on to New Songs. The entertainment show, known as Ian Hates Music, is normally a comedy show, but the co-hosts try to be open and honest and sometimes that means covering the big stories that involve a sensitive nature.

And New Songs talk from:

Born A New, Low Dose, AngelMaker, Whitechapel, Dayshell, Harm, Life Itself, The Damned Things, Our Last Night, New Idea Society, Belle, The Anchor, and Charlatan!

Add on album reviews from:

Attila - Villain - Self-Release

James makes his triumphant return to Ian Hates Music! It‚Äôs the second episode with James as co-host so the guys are still learning the rhythm of the new show, but that James guy‚Äôs got something‚Ä¶what do you want me to say? Just go listen already! It‚Äôs time for a fun episode!

Ian welcomes Joe Taylor back to Ian Hates Conversations: Music Edition! Joe is not only the lead vocalist for Versus, but he's also out on tour as his solo act Joe Taylor Must Die!

Even though Ian is very happy to have Joe back on the show, there are a lot of important reason's he's talking to Joe in this episode. Topics include label issues for Versus, the Joe Taylor Must Die solo project but also attempted suicide, depression, and a lot more. This is a very in-depth conversation.

If you're having suicidal thoughts, want to hurt yourself, or dealing with similar issues, please reach out to someone. Here's the number for the Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-273-8255.

Make sure you listen to this.

Tons more to talk about in this new episode of Ian Hates Music. Between the proposed ending of Warped Tour and more "sexual misconduct" allegations made against major bands in the scene, Ian and Dave have a lot to talk about. That's not even all! Probably a good idea for you to start listening...or not...I don't know anymore...

Get ready for your best weekly dose of metalcore, post-hardcore, metal, hardcore, electronicore, emo, screamo, rock, alternative, pop-punk, punk, easycore, deathcore, and really, all the core you could ever want!
